results.title: Where do you go from here
results.creator_credit: Jeff Inman, Ian Latimer and Rank Audio Visual
results.brief_description: Intended for use by companies that have formal management development programmes, as well as by those which use less sophisticated methods, this film helps managers develop skills necessary to making truly effective appraisal or performance improvement interviews. A skilfully handled interview is presented for in-depth study.

results.title: Where Do I Belong?
results.creator_credit: Rita el-Khoury, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Rita el-Khoury travels to Lebanon every year. She calls Australia and Lebanon her home but it wasn’t until she was caught in the middle of the 2006 Israeli bombing of Beiruit that she fully appreciated what that meant.

results.title: Where did you sleep last night?
results.creator_credit: Cliff Skelton, George Johnson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This film aims to demystify the outdated perceptions on youth prostitution. Continually throughout Canada pimps scour shopping malls, streets and schoolyards scouting for new recruits. This docu-drama illustrates how young girls from all economic backgrounds are being lured into the trade. The pimps more than before have grown in sophistication and use seductive and cunning methods to gain the trust and control over their unsuspecting victims. The film illustrates how psychological techniques are used to persuade the vulnerable into a state of trust. The rest is downhill from there.

results.title: Where did you get that woman?
results.brief_description: A delightful documentary look at the life of a 70-year-old African American women who earns a small income from a job as a night-time toilet attendant at a wealthy hotel in an area frequented by the “beautiful people”. The film contrasts her life here on the richer side of town with her more mundane existence in ahousing estate for senior citizens and, as well, provides an account of her life from childhood through the use of stills and her own colorful commentary. The film touches on many issues: the Depression era in America, poverty, race relations, city and rural life, old age, loneliness, popular music and family life. Featuring Joan Williams.

results.title: Where did I come from?
results.brief_description: Based on the book of the same title by British author Peter Mayle, this animated program presents a humorous approach to the facts of life that lets children learn while they laugh. Covers psychological differences of the sexes and the means of reproduction.

results.title: Where dead men lie
results.creator_credit: Henry Lawson, Keith Gow, Gil Brealey and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: A dramatisation based on a Henry Lawson story “The Australian Cinematograph”, made to commemorate the 50th anniversary of his death. This film was shot using the directions written by Lawson in 1896 in the days when cinema was no more than a curiosity. The story is about the fate of a drover who has driven a mob of cattle hundreds of miles across the vast dry plains of north-west Australia to their destination. Luck is against him and he doesn’t make it through the drought stricken countryside. His remains are found by a search party one of whom is chosen to take the sad news home to the drover’s wife and family.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Henry Lawson, Keith Gow, Gil Brealey and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Where breakers roar
results.creator_credit: D.W. Griffith and American Mutoscope and Biograph Company
results.brief_description: Two sub-plots - one involving a young couple in love and the other a crim who makes his escape from the police - come together in a final climactic scene at the beach. A melodrama of heroes and villains. Cast includes Arthur V. Johnson, Linda Arvidson, Charles Inslee, Edward Dillon, Mack Sennett. Silent film with no intertitles.

results.title: Where are we heading
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, Gil Brealey, Dept of Health and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Presents an open-ended look at the effects that different parental attitudes to life and the family unit have on adolescents. Directed mainly at adult audiences, especially parents and community leaders. Note: Restricted to tertiary institutions, teaching hospitals, police and customs departments.

results.title: Where angels fear to tread
results.creator_credit: Charles Sturridge, Derek Granger, Stage Screen Productions, LWT and Sovereign Picture
results.brief_description: An adaptation of E.M. Forster’s novel of romance and revenge, starring Helen Mirren, Helena Bonham-Carter, Rupert Graves, Judy Davis and Giovanni Guidelli. While visiting Italy with her companion Caroline, widowed Lilia Herriton is enraptured not only by the countryside but by a younger handsome Tuscan who seduces her. The incident outrages her family and in-law Philip Herriton arrives to end the affair but it is too late as the couple are married. After a tragedy occurs, Philip and his sister embark on another mission; to bring back the couple’s infant son. A tug-of-war ensues between father and family.
